classmeta.shortdesc: A widget for displaying both trees and lists.

desc.para: A GtkTreeView can display both list and tree structures. To display a list, pass a GtkListStore object to the constructor or set_model. For a tree, use a GtkTreeStore object. Basically any object of a class that implements the GtkTreeModel interface is suitable.

After creating the view and setting the model, you need to create some GtkTreeViewColumns and add them to the view with append_column. The column widgets themselves need some GtkCellRenderers that actually draw and display the data of the model.
To obtain the selected rows of the view, get the view's GtkTreeSelection object that manages the selection by using get_selection. If you want to track if it changes, connect its changed signal.
Creates a new GtkTreeView, optionally with a data store. If you don't set a it on construction, you can use set_model after.

example.title: GtkTreeview with sortable columns and some data

method.shortdesc: Appends a column to the view.

desc.para: Appends a column at the end (i.e. the most right place) of the view.

example.title: Appending a column to a tree view

desc.para: &seealso; get_column, insert_column, remove_column

method.shortdesc: Collapses all nodes.

desc.para: Recursively collapses all visible, expanded nodes in the tree view.

method.shortdesc: Collapses a given row.

desc.para: Collapses the row at the given path (hides its child rows, if they exist).

method.shortdesc: Resizes all columns to their optimal width.

desc.para: Resizes all columns to their optimal width. Only works after the treeview has been realized.

method.shortdesc: Creates a GdkPixmap representation of the row

desc.para: Creates a GdkPixmap representation of the row at path. This image is used for a drag icon.

method.shortdesc: Recursively expands all nodes in the tree view.

desc.para: Recursively expands all nodes in the tree view.

method.shortdesc: Opens the row so its children are visible.

desc.para: Opens the row so its children are visible.

method.shortdesc: Expands the row to a path.

desc.para: Expands the row at path. This will also expand all parent rows of path as necessary.

method.shortdesc: Returns the window that the view renders to.

desc.para: Returns the window that tree_view renders to. This is used primarily to compare to event->window to confirm that the event on tree view is on the right window.

method.shortdesc: Gets the GtkTreeViewColumn at the given position

desc.para: Gets the GtkTreeViewColumn at the given position.
&seealso; append_column, insert_column, remove_column

method.shortdesc: Returns the current path and focus column.

desc.para: Returns an array with the current path and the GtkTreeViewColumn that are active at the moment.
&seealso; set_cursor

method.shortdesc: Whether or not the tree allows interactive searching.

desc.para: Returns whether or not the tree allows interactive searching.
&seealso; set_enable_search

method.shortdesc: Returns the column that is the current expander column.

desc.para: Returns the column that is the current expander column. This column has the expander arrow drawn next to it.
&seealso; set_expander_column

method.shortdesc: Whether fixed height mode is turned on or not.

desc.para: Returns whether fixed height mode is turned on for the tree view.
&seealso; set_fixed_height_mode

method.shortdesc: Gets the GtkAdjustment for the horizontal aspect.

desc.para: Gets the GtkAdjustment currently being used for the horizontal aspect.
&seealso; set_hadjustment

method.shortdesc: If the headers on the view are visible.

desc.para: Returns true if the headers in the view are visible.
&seealso; set_headers_visible

method.shortdesc: Whether hover expansion mode is turned on.

desc.para: Returns whether hover expansion mode is turned on for the view.
&seealso; set_hover_expand

method.shortdesc: Whether hover selection mode is turned on.

desc.para: Returns whether hover selection mode is turned on for the view.
&seealso; set_hover_selection

method.shortdesc: Returns the model used.

desc.para: Returns the tree/list model used to hold the data.
&seealso; set_model

method.shortdesc: Returns the tree path at a pixel position.

desc.para: Returns the tree path at the given pixel position. The coordinates have to be widget coordinates.

The returned array has four elements:
array of the row at the position
GtkTreeViewColumn
cell_x
cell_y

method.shortdesc: Whether the user can reorder rows via drag-and-drop.

desc.para: Retrieves whether the user can reorder the tree via drag-and-drop.
&seealso; set_reorderable

method.shortdesc: Returns the rules_hint setting.

desc.para: Gets the setting set by set_rules_hint.
&seealso; set_rules_hint

method.shortdesc: Returns the column id used for searches.

desc.para: Returns the column id used for searches.
&seealso; set_search_column

method.shortdesc: Returns the selection object associated with the view.

desc.para: This method returns the GtkTreeSelection object associated with the view. The selection object itself contains all the data about a selection, be it just a single row, or multiple rows that are selected.
Always keep in mind that the view, not the underlying model, has a selection! That means that different views of the same model can have different selections.
&seealso; set_vadjustment
&seealso; append_column, get_column, remove_column

method.shortdesc: Inserts a column at the given position with a data function assigned.

desc.para: This method inserts a new column into a GtkTreeView at the given position with a given name. In contrast to insert_column and append_column this method creates the column object internally and allows you to specify a data function, which is called everytime a cell in the model for this column changed and needs to be rendered.

The provided callback function receives the following parameters to act on them:
GtkTreeViewColumn The column object created by the insert_column_with_data_func call.
GtkCellRenderer The cell renderer used to display this cell.
GtkTreeModel The model rendered by the tree view.
GtkTreeIter The tree row affected by the change.
Inside the data function you most propably want to change the GtkCellRenderer, which is responsible for displaying.
&seealso; append_column, get_column, insert_column
&seealso; get_cursor
&seealso; get_drag_dest_row

method.shortdesc: Sets whether or not interactive search is enabled for the view.

desc.para: Sets whether or not interactive search (also called typeahead find) is enabled for the view. If interactive search is enable, an entry box will appear if a user begins typing while the view has focus. The selection for the view will move to a row matching what the user types.
Even if interactive search is turned off, the user can still initiate a search using the "start-interactive-search" key binding.
&seealso; get_enable_search
&seealso; get_expander_column
&seealso; get_fixed_height_mode

method.shortdesc: Sets the GtkAdjustment for the current horizontal aspect.

desc.para: Sets the GtkAdjustment for the current horizontal aspect.
Under normal circumstances you don't need this method if you use a GtkScrolledWindow and add the view to it.
&seealso; get_headers_visible
&seealso; get_hover_expand
&seealso; get_hover_selection

method.shortdesc: Sets the model for the view.

desc.para: Sets the model for the view. If the view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If model is null, then it will unset the old model.
&seealso; get_model

method.shortdesc: Allow/disallow reordering of model rows.

desc.para: This function is a convenience function to allow you to reorder models that support the GtkDragSourceIface and the GtkDragDestIface. Both GtkTreeStore and GtkListStore support these. If reorderable is true, then the user can reorder the model by dragging and dropping rows. The developer can listen to these changes by connecting to the model's row-inserted and row-deleted signals.
This function does not give you any degree of control over the order - any reordering is allowed. If more control is needed, you should probably handle drag and drop manually.
&seealso; get_reorderable
&seealso; get_row_separator_func
&seealso; get_rules_hint

method.shortdesc: Sets the column of the interactive search.

desc.para: Sets column as the column where the interactive search code should search in. Additionally, turns on interactive searching.

note.para: The column refers to a column of the model.

desc.para: &seealso; get_search_column
&seealso; get_search_equal_func

method.shortdesc: Sets the GtkAdjustment for the current vertical aspect.

desc.para: Sets the GtkAdjustment for the current vertical aspect.
Under normal circumstances you don't need this method if you use a GtkScrolledWindow and add the view to it.

signal.shortdesc: Signal emmitted when a row in a GtkTreeView is double-clicked.
